title: CSV Custom Export format in New Expensify does not match the format exported from Expensify Classic.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: Melvin Triage
labels.description: Melvin Triage of an issue

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @Liz-Canary
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770590185152729)

## Action Performed:

1. Go to Expensify Classic.
2. Configure the Export format with Time Stamp, Client Exec, Client Srvc,, Client Rep, Client Loc, Billing Month fields
3. Export Reports using CSV Custom Export
4. Note the exported format and included fields
5. Go to New Expensify (ND)
6. Export the same Reports using CSV Custom Export
7. Compare the two files

## Expected Result:
CSV Custom Export in New Expensify should match the format and field consistency of Expensify Classic.
All configured custom fields (Time Stamp, Client Exec, Client Srvc, Client Rep, Client Loc, Billing Month) should appear in the export.
## Actual Result:
Fields listed above are missing or inconsistently displayed in the New Expensify export.
Export format does not match Classic.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

The screenshot for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770590185152729)

[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

## Action Performed:
1. Create workspace > Enable Report
2. Create a few report fields. (Without initial value)
3. Create an expense to that workspace
4. Click on that expense
5. Notice that GBR appears while there is report field error
## Expected Result:
No GBR when report field error displayed

## Actual Result:
GBR appears when there is report field error
## Workaround:
Unknown

body: If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.20-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @shawnborton **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771258756987229) ## Action Performed: 1. Open a report with multiple expenses 2. View the expense table 3. Observe the width of the Reimbursable column ## Expected Result: The Reimbursable column should use a fixed width. Width should be just wide enough to comfortably fit the word “Reimbursable” (header) and values “Yes” / “No”. The column should not occupy unnecessary horizontal space. ## Actual Result: The Reimbursable column is wider than needed. It consumes more horizontal space than its content requires. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.20-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @twisterdotcom **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771238613230259) ## Action Performed: 1. Create an expense 2. Save the expense 3. Open the expense for editing 4. Tap/click on Date ## Expected Result: The date picker should open immediately upon tapping/clicking “Date” No additional tap should be required This behavior should be consistent anywhere in the app where a single Date field pushes to its own page — the picker should auto-open upon navigation. ## Actual Result: User is navigated to the Date page The date picker does not open automatically User must tap the date field again to open it ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8a0db44b-b670-4581-a07c-cfd9a6656421 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: The Reconciliation Dashboard in New Expensify displays different totals compared to Expensify Classic

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily

labels.name: Help Wanted

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.19-5
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @PedroEspinoza1999 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771264799329369)

## Action Performed:

1. User logs in to New Expensify.
2. Navigates to the Reconciliation Dashboard.
3. Reviews the total amount listed under Withdrawns.
4. Logs in to Expensify Classic.
5. Navigates to the corresponding Reconciliation section.
6. Compares the totals between Classic and New Expensify.

## Expected Result:
The Reconciliation Dashboard in New Expensify should match the totals shown in Expensify Classic, including accurate Withdrawn amounts.
## Actual Result:
The Withdrawns total in New Expensify does not match Classic. Classic reflects the correct amount, while New Expensify displays an incorrect total.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

The screenshots for the issue are in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771264799329369)
